pageTitle: Vietnam Tour of Duty Photographs from Tom Harrison
pageIntro:
A collection of photographs from Tom Harrison (Charlie Company, 1st Battalion, 3rd Marines) taken during his tour of duty in the Vietnam War.

Photographs © 1966-2020 Thomas Harrison; published with permission as compliments to The Cage, an in-progress book project.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: Scott (last name), Dula, Jenkens at haircut time.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: Dula & Widner in back of our gun hole. The gun is covered up.

photos.subtitle: Khe Sanh
photos.content: Helfer in doorway of our hooch with wet clothes hanging on "line." In the far background, center of photo is Hill 881. To the right of the photo (just out view) is Hill 861.

photos.subtitle: In Squad Bay on the USS Okinawa (LPH-3)
photos.content: (L-R) Mike Hartman, Rowe, Cpl. John Hughes

photos.subtitle: Burning "gook" houses.
photos.content: Note: The derogatory term, "gook," which appeared in the handwritten description on the back of this photo is reprinted as originally written for its factual and historical significance.

photos.subtitle: Operation Buffalo
photos.content: Helfer. This and the following two photos were taken just after the big fight on Operation Buffalo. The temperature was extremely hot.
